name: incommensurably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that cannot reasonably be compared or judged by the same measure or standard: The presence of women in professional and public life is now incommensurably greater than it was in the 1960s. Other traditions developed ways of life and moral schemes that not only are different from our own, but incommensurably so.
More examplesFewer examplesThis new production of the show is radically different in terms of rhythm, which is now incommensurably faster and less predictable.They do not explain why they regard one type of well-being as incommensurably superior to another.
